intro: Papaver alpinum subvar. elegans, commonly known as the Alpine poppy, is a striking member of the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its vibrant, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from deep red to orange, often with a contrasting black center. Native to the alpine regions of Europe, this plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens that mimic its natural habitat.
